name: Sheraton Needham Hotel

reviews.text: I just returned from a one week stay at this hotel. I've stayed in this hotel several times since 2005 and have experienced the GREAT renovation in all areas. Lobby and social areas are really nice and clean. My room was spacious and CLEAN. In terms of the staff, Everyone was friendly and helpful. Prior my arrival Charlie helped me schedule my stay in a very efficient and personalized way. Upon arrival, Ernie who is the concierge-shuttle driver helped me to get my way around. Ann who works in the executive office was very helpful . All the ladies at the front desk, personnel at the restaurant/bar were very efficient and friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel. To any friend going to MA.
reviews.title: GREAT renovation-AMAZING staff

reviews.text: The lobby is equipped with a state of the art computer area with printer facility that helps a lot. I am looking forward to my next visit!
reviews.title: Clean and Modern; Friendly Staff

reviews.text: My only observation id that the elevator could be a bit better to be according to the huge renovation the hotel have been thru.
reviews.title: CustomerFirst

reviews.text: I stayed at the Sheraton Needham for 2 nights as I was taking the CFP exam at the hotel. The hotel is conveniently located right off I-95 and a short drive to the center of town. The front desk staff was gracious and accommodating upon my arrival, even calling my room after I checked in to make sure everything was to my satisfaction. The room was modern and clean, with spectacular prints of Boston in the bed and bathrooms. I had dinner at the bar both nights, and the same bartender was on duty both nights. She was funny and engaging, and checked on the status of the exam each time I saw her. The meeting room itself was private and quiet, the perfect environment for such a rigorous test. Thank you for a comfortable room, helpful staff, good food and a quiet meeting room! The perfect environment for passing my exam!
reviews.title: Not bad, not great

reviews.text: Hotel is very well maintained. The staff is exceptional, always putting the customer 1st!, with that said I would like to give a special thanks to Ms. Anne Engel of the executive office, for understanding & taking care of my needs. If anyone ever has a problem here, just ask for her and she will be more than glad to take care of your concerns or needs!!
reviews.title: Perfectly fine hotel, super nice staff
When I am in Boston, you can find me here...
reviews.text: I have been traveling to the Boston area for business on a regular basis for the past several years. During my numerous such trips, I have always stayed at Sheraton Needham except when rooms were sold out for my travel dates. The location of the hotel is very close to my client's office and provides quick and easy access to I-95/128 and Masspike. All rooms in the hotel have been recently upgraded along with all other amenities. The staff is friendly and service is excellent. I don't always have the breakfast, but whenever I have had it, it was good. I will be back next week.

After receiving a personal invitation to return to the hotel, by the manager (who seems to read and respond to Trip Advisor reviews), I found lots of hot water and a very pleasant stay. This hotel is the best location for the 128/95 area easy on and off the highway and close to the Mass Pike into and out of Boston.
reviews.title: The manager does read Trip Advisor Reviews

reviews.text: I will be back.
reviews.title: Comfortable and convenient

reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights. Very close to a meeting we attended. Almost persuaded to take the Internet, parking and breakfast package but luckily found out there was complimentary Internet in the rooms, adequate breakfast at the cafe and there were plenty parking spaces outside the hotel's garages saving $30-40 a night. Room was comfortable but disappointed that milk and teas were not replaced daily. Probably would stay again.
reviews.title: Still a little dated based on my opinion...

reviews.text: Based on the recent reviews posted, Sheraton seems to have gone through a phase of renovation. I stayed for a day for Sheraton Needham in March and I was given a room with 2 double bed. The room was very big and clean, but it feels very dated still. I've stayed in the hotel pre-renovation, so I can't compare much.
reviews.title: Nice stay with friendly staff

reviews.text: I did not love this hotel - for many reasons. I needed to navigate stairs to reach my room - not a big deal normally, except that with this trip I had luggage and about 6 FedEx boxes to carry, so it was a bit of a hardship. I had a connecting room (boo) on the ground floor (boo) and the room had so many safety features in it that it actually caused me to be concerned about safety. In all, a dated property - but, what can you do? Knock down a building every 10 years and create waste in remodeling just for our changing tastes? That is absolutely wasteful -- especially when the datedness can be offset through quality service.
reviews.title: Dated property for sure - but service above normal!

reviews.text: Which brings me to ANNE ENGEL! Hip hip hooray for ANNE ENGEL! Here's my story -- I had FedEx boxes shipped to me in care of this hotel, and, most of the boxes arrived. One, however, did not arrive on time; and, of course, it was the one box I needed the next day. Not the hotel's fault, certainly. But even so, the hotel went out of their way to make sure I could be connected with my box, when it arrived the next day -- after I checked out.
reviews.title: 'Exceptional'

reviews.text: The box did arrive the next morning. And, in all honesty, the hotel temporary lost the box for about 4 hours. So that was a tad disappointing. But, once they found it, we had made arrangements for a cab to drive the box to where I was, where I would then pay the cab driver.
reviews.title: Ok just ok

reviews.text: Anne, the hotel shuttle bus driver, told the front desk staff that that was ridiculous -- that the hotel was responsible in part for the box being delayed in its delivery to me, and, needed to honor its role in that problem. So, she took the shuttle bus out to where my meeting was and personally delivered the box to me. This was, I'm sure, a considerable inconvenience for her, but it was greatly appreciated by me. And, frankly, if she had not done that, I don't think the box would have arrived in time for my meeting; as it was, I had about 45 minutes leeway between the box arriving, and my meeting beginning.
reviews.title: Great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So - again, hip hip hooray for Anne, I say! And for the front desk staff overall!
reviews.title: Friendly hotel near Boston Rt 95 and Mass Pike

reviews.text: I'm not sure how to approach this review: the hotel is great, the staff is super competent, but the dining/bar area leaves a bit to be desired, and I hesitate about how strongly that should factor in to a review given it's a hotel - not a restaurant.
reviews.title: Hotel service is great, restaurant is slow and understaffed

reviews.text: First, the good: the staff is wonderful, rooms are clean, wifi is slow-ish but comes at no charge, and there's a nice little free breakfast bar on the 5th floor with a self-serve espresso machine. The hotel provides a complimentary shuttle to local businesses, and the driver is super-nice.
reviews.title: Convenient and Friendly

reviews.text: Now the bad, though there's not much to say here: the food options here are limited (it's intended to be more of a bar with a few dishes than a full dining room). The bar/eating area is really understaffed - I come down every day while staying here on business, and during rush hour I often see 20-30 people and just 1-2 servers. This means if you don't go up to the bar yourself to request what you want, you're likely to wait a long time for food or for your bill.
reviews.title: Room clean but unpleasant staff in restaurant

reviews.text: Important tip: between 5pm and 8pm, the bar has a terrific deal called "Social Hour" where they serve a flight of 3 glasses of 2oz wines for 8$. Good selections, and well worth it.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: Stayed at Sheraton Needham for a couple of days for business. Comfortable and clean room and friendly staff. But want to give a special shout out to Ann Engel, the person who picked me up on the shuttle bus outside its normally scheduled service. She was great and I appreciated the ride so much.
reviews.title: Service to match business day

description: The Sheraton Needham is adjacent to the Interstate 95/Massachusetts Route 128 high-tech corridor. Just minutes from downtown Boston, our hotel has 4,500 square feet of meeting space.
